intro: Saltugilia, commonly known as the saltbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically shrubs or subshrubs that thrive in saline and arid environments. They are characterized by their small, often succulent leaves that help reduce water loss. Saltugilia species are adapted to high salinity soils and can tolerate extreme drought conditions. They play an important role in stabilizing soil in coastal and desert regions.
